certifications.name: Scuba Diver
limits: Must dive under direct supervision of a professional
certifications.notes: Entry-level subset of Open Water; upgrade path to OWD.

certifications.name: Open Water Diver

general: Minimum age 10 years (or 15 for full certification)

certifications.notes: Core entry-level certification for autonomous recreational diving within limits.

certifications.name: Advanced Open Water Diver
limits: Recommended max depth 30 m (100 ft) for adults, 21 m (70 ft) for 12-14 years
certifications.notes: Depth adventure dive typically extends training to 30 m.

certifications.name: Rescue Diver

general: Current CPR/First Aid certification (e.g., EFR Primary and Secondary Care)

limits: Focus on problem prevention and management
certifications.notes: Required for many leadership tracks and 'Master' recognition ratings.

certifications.name: Master Scuba Diver
limits: Recognition rating; no new depth privileges by itself
certifications.notes: Non-professional recognition of experience and training breadth.

certifications.name: Enriched Air (Nitrox) Diver
limits: Use of nitrox mixes within agency limits (commonly up to 40% O2)
Plan PPO2 â‰¤ agency recommended values
No decompression dives unless otherwise qualified
certifications.notes: Most common specialty for extending NDLs at modest depths.

certifications.name: Deep Diver
limits: Training to dive to 40 m (130 ft) within recreational limits
certifications.notes: Extends recreational depth training to the 40 m recreational limit.

certifications.name: Tec 40
limits: One decompression gas (common: up to 50% O2)
certifications.notes: Bridge from recreational to technical; equipment and procedures training.

certifications.name: Tec 45
limits: Use of a single high-O2 decompression gas (often up to 100% O2)
Complex dive planning and emergency procedures
certifications.notes: Builds on Tec 40 with deeper/longer exposures and higher O2 for deco.

certifications.name: Tec 50
limits: Deeper/longer staged decompression dives per standards
certifications.notes: Completes the core 'tec deep' open circuit sequence before trimix.

certifications.name: Tec Trimix 65
limits: Trimix for dives up to ~65 m (210 ft)
certifications.notes: Introduces normoxic trimix for deeper OC dives.

certifications.name: Tec Trimix Diver
limits: Full trimix training for very deep dives (commonly cited up to ~90 m/300 ft)
certifications.notes: Full normoxic/hypoxic trimix capabilities per standards.

certifications.name: Tec 40 CCR Diver
limits: CCR air or nitrox diluent within training depth
certifications.notes: Entry-level closed-circuit rebreather certification on specific units.

certifications.name: Tec 60 CCR Diver
limits: Deeper CCR dives with staged decompression
certifications.notes: Builds on CCR basics for deeper/longer exposures.

certifications.name: Tec 100 CCR Diver
limits: Advanced mixed-gas CCR dives with significant decompression obligations
certifications.notes: Highest level CCR training in the TecRec progression.

certifications.name: Divemaster

general: Minimum 40 logged dives to start, 60 to certify
Current EFR Primary and Secondary Care or equivalent

certifications.notes: First professional-level rating in PADI system.

certifications.name: Wreck Diver
certifications.notes: Covers wreck diving techniques, hazards, and marine archaeology ethics.

certifications.name: Underwater Navigator
certifications.notes: Natural navigation and compass navigation techniques.

certifications.name: Night Diver
certifications.notes: Night diving techniques, light signals, and nocturnal marine life.

certifications.name: Drift Diver
certifications.notes: Techniques for diving in currents.

certifications.name: Peak Performance Buoyancy
certifications.notes: Fine-tune buoyancy control, trim, and streamlining.

certifications.name: Search and Recovery Diver
certifications.notes: Search patterns, recovery techniques, and lift bag use.

certifications.name: Underwater Photographer
certifications.notes: Digital underwater photography principles and techniques.

certifications.name: Sidemount Diver
certifications.notes: Sidemount configuration and techniques for open water.

certifications.name: Dry Suit Diver
certifications.notes: Dry suit selection, care, and diving techniques.

certifications.name: Ice Diver
certifications.notes: Overhead environment diving under ice with tether and safety procedures.

certifications.name: Altitude Diver
certifications.notes: Diving at altitudes above 300 m (1000 ft); special planning required.

certifications.name: Boat Diver
certifications.notes: Boat diving procedures, etiquette, and techniques.

certifications.name: Equipment Specialist
certifications.notes: Scuba equipment care, maintenance, and minor repairs.

certifications.name: Self-Reliant Diver
certifications.notes: Solo diving skills and emergency self-sufficiency.

certifications.name: Underwater Videographer
certifications.notes: Underwater video techniques, editing basics, and storytelling.

certifications.name: Emergency Oxygen Provider
certifications.notes: Emergency oxygen administration for diving injuries; not a diving certification.

certifications.name: Scuba Diver
limits: Must dive under direct supervision of a professional
certifications.notes: Entry-level subset of Open Water; upgrade path to OWD.

certifications.name: Open Water Diver
certifications.notes: SSI core entry-level certification.

certifications.name: Advanced Adventurer
limits: Recommended max depth 30 m (100 ft) with Deep Adventure dive
certifications.notes: SSI's structured sampler leading toward specialties and higher training.

certifications.name: Diver Stress & Rescue
certifications.notes: Core rescue-level training; prerequisite for SSI leadership tracks.

certifications.name: Enriched Air Nitrox 40
certifications.notes: Core specialty for longer no-stop times.

certifications.name: Master Diver
limits: Recognition rating; no additional depth privileges
certifications.notes: SSI's highest non-professional recognition level.

certifications.name: Dive Guide
certifications.notes: SSI professional-level certification.

certifications.name: Deep Diving
certifications.notes: Training to 40 m (130 ft) within recreational limits.

certifications.name: Wreck Diving
certifications.notes: External wreck exploration and limited penetration.

certifications.name: Night & Limited Visibility
certifications.notes: Night diving and low visibility techniques.

certifications.name: Navigation
certifications.notes: Compass and natural navigation techniques.

certifications.name: Search & Recovery
certifications.notes: Search patterns and object recovery techniques.

certifications.name: Sidemount Diving
certifications.notes: Sidemount configuration for open water.

certifications.name: Perfect Buoyancy
certifications.notes: Advanced buoyancy control and trim techniques.

certifications.name: Dry Suit Diving
certifications.notes: Dry suit techniques and maintenance.

certifications.name: Photo & Video
certifications.notes: Underwater photography and videography.

certifications.name: Waves, Tides & Currents
certifications.notes: Understanding and diving in dynamic water conditions.

certifications.name: Scuba Diver
limits: Must dive under direct supervision of a professional
certifications.notes: Entry-level subset of Open Water; upgrade path to OWSD.

certifications.name: Open Water Scuba Diver
certifications.notes: Recreational entry-level certification within International Training.

certifications.name: Advanced Adventure Diver
limits: Recommended max depth 30 m (100 ft) with deep module
certifications.notes: Sample of specialties; stepping stone toward Rescue.

certifications.name: Rescue Diver
certifications.notes: Core rescue-level training for SDI path.

certifications.name: Master Scuba Diver
certifications.notes: Experience recognition rating.

certifications.name: Computer Nitrox
limits: Nitrox use per training (commonly up to 40% O2)
certifications.notes: Nitrox planning and use focused on dive computers.

certifications.name: Divemaster
certifications.notes: SDI professional-level certification.

certifications.name: Deep Diver
certifications.notes: Training to 40 m (130 ft) within recreational limits.

certifications.name: Wreck Diver
certifications.notes: Wreck diving techniques and safety.

certifications.name: Night & Limited Visibility
certifications.notes: Night diving techniques.

certifications.name: Underwater Navigation
certifications.notes: Navigation techniques.

certifications.name: Search & Recovery
certifications.notes: Search and recovery techniques.

certifications.name: Sidemount Diver
certifications.notes: Sidemount configuration for open water.

certifications.name: Dry Suit Diver
certifications.notes: Dry suit diving techniques.

certifications.name: Ice Diver
certifications.notes: Ice diving with overhead environment procedures.

certifications.name: Underwater Photographer
certifications.notes: Underwater photography techniques.

certifications.name: Intro to Tech

general: Buoyancy and equipment proficiency per standards

limits: Skills-focused; does not grant decompression privileges by itself
certifications.notes: Foundational skills for technical diving equipment and procedures.

certifications.name: Advanced Nitrox Diver
limits: Use of EANx > 40% up to pure O2 for accelerated decompression when combined with DP
No staged decompression unless combined with DP
certifications.notes: Often paired with Decompression Procedures.

certifications.name: Decompression Procedures Diver
limits: Staged decompression dives within training limits
One or more deco gases per standards
certifications.notes: Teaches staged decompression planning and execution. Often combined with Advanced Nitrox as AN/DP.

certifications.name: Extended Range Diver
limits: Air/nitrox to deeper ranges with staged decompression
certifications.notes: Culmination of AN/DP path prior to trimix.

certifications.name: Trimix Diver (Normoxic)
certifications.notes: First level trimix for deeper dives with helium to manage narcosis.

certifications.name: Advanced Trimix Diver
limits: Hypoxic trimix per standards for very deep dives
certifications.notes: Highest OC trimix level in many systems.

certifications.name: CCR Air Diluent Diver
limits: Unit-specific CCR training with air/nitrox diluent
certifications.notes: Entry-level CCR unit-specific qualification.

certifications.name: Nitrox Diver
certifications.notes: Basic nitrox certification for recreational diving.

certifications.name: Helitrox Diver
certifications.notes: Entry-level helium diving without full trimix commitment.

certifications.name: Cavern Diver
certifications.notes: First step in overhead environment training.

certifications.name: Intro to Cave Diver
certifications.notes: Bridge between cavern and full cave.

certifications.name: Full Cave Diver
limits: Stages and decompression if separately qualified
certifications.notes: Highest cave qualification in TDI system.

certifications.name: Sidemount Diver
certifications.notes: Sidemount configuration for technical and cave diving.

certifications.name: Wreck Diver
certifications.notes: External wreck exploration.

certifications.name: Advanced Wreck Diver
certifications.notes: Limited penetration and wreck exploration beyond recreational limits.

certifications.name: CCR Helitrox Diver
certifications.notes: CCR diving with helium-based diluents.

certifications.name: CCR Advanced Mixed Gas Diver
certifications.notes: Highest level CCR certification in TDI system.

certifications.name: CMAS One Star Diver (*)
limits: Autonomous within training and local regulations
certifications.notes: Issued through national federations; limits may vary by federation.

certifications.name: CMAS Two Star Diver (**)
limits: No decompression (unless local federation standards allow training exposures)
certifications.notes: Intermediate diver with broader skills; national specifics apply.

certifications.name: CMAS Three Star Diver (***)
limits: Leadership-level recreational diving within federation rules
certifications.notes: Experienced diver grade; not an instructor but high competency.

certifications.name: CMAS Four Star Diver (****)

general: Leadership and instructor prerequisites per federation

certifications.notes: Instructor level or equivalent in CMAS federations.

certifications.name: Ocean Diver
limits: Typical depth 20 m (66 ft) after progression
certifications.notes: Club-based initial qualification in the BSAC system.

certifications.name: Sports Diver
limits: Progressive depth increases (commonly up to 35 m/115 ft with experience sign-offs)
Planned decompression techniques via BSAC training pathways
certifications.notes: Adds rescue elements and progression to deeper depths.

certifications.name: Dive Leader
limits: Dive management responsibilities within club framework
certifications.notes: Leadership qualification preparing for instructor progression.

certifications.name: Advanced Diver
certifications.notes: BSAC advanced recreational level.

certifications.name: First Class Diver
certifications.notes: BSAC's highest non-leadership diver grade.

certifications.name: GUE Fundamentals
limits: Not a depth rating; skill and configuration standardization
certifications.notes: Performance-based pass (rec/tech rating) gating higher GUE training.

certifications.name: Tech 1

general: GUE Fundamentals passed at tech rating

certifications.notes: Standardized team-protocol technical course.

certifications.name: Tech 2
limits: Hypoxic trimix dives within course limits
certifications.notes: Advanced team-based helium diving.

certifications.name: Recreational Diver 1
certifications.notes: GUE's entry-level recreational certification with standardized equipment configuration.

certifications.name: Recreational Diver 2
limits: Extended depth training within GUE recreational standards
certifications.notes: GUE advanced recreational level.

certifications.name: Recreational Diver 3
limits: Advanced recreational diving with GUE protocols
certifications.notes: Highest GUE recreational level.

certifications.name: Cave 1

general: GUE Fundamentals passed at tech rating

limits: Single tanks or stages per standards
certifications.notes: GUE's standardized cave training level 1.

certifications.name: Cave 2
certifications.notes: GUE's highest cave certification with advanced techniques.

certifications.name: Advanced Nitrox Diver
limits: High-O2 mixes for accelerated decompression when paired with deco training
certifications.notes: IANTD pioneered nitrox training; pathways vary by region.

certifications.name: Normoxic Trimix Diver
certifications.notes: Helium-based gas management and staged decompression.

certifications.name: Open Water Diver
certifications.notes: IANTD recreational entry-level.

certifications.name: Nitrox Diver
certifications.notes: IANTD pioneered nitrox training.
